title: Gradient entropy (GradEn): The two dimensional version of slope entropy for image analysis
author: Runze Jiang (Beijing Jiaotong University), Pengjian Shang (Beijing Jiaotong University), ...
relevance_why: The methodology for image analysis introduced in this paper could inspire new approaches to audio-visual data processing, especially in utilizing texture characterization in audio image representations.
background: Analyzing 2D image data by quantifying irregularity and complexity using entropy methods which combine symbolic patterns and amplitude information.
contribution: This paper introduces Gradient Entropy (GradEn) to solve two-dimensional image analysis challenges, achieving improved classification capabilities across various types of images compared to existing 2D entropy measures.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like two-dimensional sample entropy and distribution entropy failed to effectively distinguish textures in many cases due to their limitations in processing symbolic patterns and amplitude information.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves on those methods by integrating both symbolic gradient information and amplitude variations, which enhances the discriminative power of texture analysis.

key_innovation: GradEn combines symbolic representation and gradient amplitude information, providing a more nuanced approach to texture feature extraction.
real_world_impact: GradEn has the potential to enhance image classification tasks in various applications, from industrial fault diagnosis to texture analysis in digital images.
limitations: No limitations are explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Gradient Entropy: **Gradient Entropy (GradEn)** is a novel method that quantifies image complexity by analyzing pixel gradients in various directions, effectively capturing the texture characteristics of images.
